indicators.justification:
The research found only one station in the region of Bawshar, Muscat - Oman. The station is managed by the private company IQAir. (1) There is a record about Oman at the WHO organisation, however data seems to be not accurate as it indicates 100 between 2000 and 2019 for Urban,Rural, Min and Max values (2).

Environment authority have a GHG emissions dataset (3) which include ODS amount and CO2 emission per ton, however the dataset last update is 2018.

## References

1- https://www.iqair.com/us/oman/muscat/bawshar/east-al-ilam
2- https://www.who.int/data/gho/data/themes/air-pollution/household-air-pollution
3- https://eservices.meca.gov.om/eservices/opendata/climate/GhgEmissions.aspx

indicators.justification:
The research found no dataset published by the government or NGO regarding endangered species and ecosystem. Oman seems to give very high importance to endangered species, as the country issued Animals Welfare Law 21/2017 to protect animals in the country (1). 

One of the specialities of the Environment authority of Oman is Nature conservation (2) however there is only some literature and a list of nature reserves (3) without further details. The open Data section of the website include a dataset of tourist's nationality having visited nature reserves in Oman (4). 

The NGO environment society of Oman have a section for projects and actions to protect environment and endangered species but without any data published (5). WWF organisation talk about 400 species of migratory birds in the region of UAE/Oman. The report mention some endangered species such as the Arabian leopard and Arabian tahr, in addition to the several species of turtle including the endangered green turtle and the critically endangered hawksbill turtle (6).

In 1986, Oman had announced a National Strategy for Protecting the Omani Environment. It aims generally at protecting the environment, evaluating and controlling the pollution and finding and implementing solutions. The legal Framework to protect environment in Oman is available on Omanuna portal (7).

indicators.justification:
The research did not find any dataset related to climate vulnerability in Oman.

According to the Royal Decree 85/2000, all climate matters have been transferred to the Civil Aviation Authority while the Environment Agency oversees issues related to the environment (1). 

Although Oman has long been a party to several international climate treaties, such as the United Nations Structural Charter on Climate Change, signed in 1992 and ratified in 1994, the inclusion of domestic climate change policies alongside environmental policies has It was mainly triggered by the devastating effects of Hurricane Gonu, which hit the country in 2007 (2) (3).

In 2019, Oman ratified the Paris Climate Agreement (4) and issued a national strategy to mitigate and adapt to climate change (5).

In the Biennial update report submitted by ministry of environment and climate affairs (November 2019) (6), there is a brief section that talk about climate change vulnerability  with current situation and sectors that could be affected by climate change in the future.

## References

1- https://mjla.gov.om/Download.aspx?Path=royal/85-2020.pdf 
2- https://agsiw.org/ar/omans-tradition-of-environmental-protection-runs-into-economic-headwinds-arabic/
3- https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cyclone_Gonu#Oman
4- https://treaties.un.org/Pages/ViewDetails.aspx?src=TREATY&mtdsg_no=XXVII-7-d&chapter=27&clang=_en
5- https://www.omanobserver.om/article/33180/Business/national-strategy-to-mitigate-impacts-of-climate-change
6- https://unfccc.int/sites/default/files/resource/BUR%20(17%20nov%202019)%20(Final)%20(1).pdf

evidence.title: Biennial update report submitted by ministry of environment and climate affairs

indicators.justification:
The research found no dataset about the real-time capacity of the healthcare system in Oman.
 
Regarding Covid-19, only general information are published on the official social media account related to the pandemic in Oman (1) including new confirmed cases, new deaths, total cases, total deaths, recent admission, current ICU admission, total admission... etc. The ministry of Health publish only list of hospitals and bed in their open data section without any details on occupation (2).

indicators.justification:
Oman is publishing Government budget published since 1978 until 2021 (1), and monthly report including government spending, debt, and borrowing between January 2019 and April 2020 (2).

The national open data portal have a section for public finance (3) where you can choose region, indicators, date range to get detailed result. Data available between 2010 and 2020.

Civil society managed portal OpenData.om have a state budget dataset (4)(5) which covers the projected and actual budget for the government of the Sultanate of Oman between 2016 and 2021 with meta data, and open format CSV.

Oman have an open data initiative since 2013 managed by the ministry of transport, communication, and information technology (1). The initiative seems to be not active anymore since May 2019, after the Oman Open Data Competition 2019.(2) 

A new Open Data Action plan have been recently released (3) on July 2021 and cover the period 2021-2024.

indicators.justification:
Omani government provides training to their civil servants through the institute of capability development (1). The only digital program available in this institute is the Digital fluency Program (2). The program focus on The future of work and the new economy,  Readiness for the future, Digital literacy, Government innovation, and Digital security. However there is no indication if  data literacy and data skills are part of such program.

indicators.justification:
The research did not find any draft laws or regulations found in Oman that provide a comprehensive framework for consistent data management and publication. 

Oman have only a state records classification law related to secrets and confidential documents (1). This law does not expressly recognise "open" or "public" as a category under which government information may be classified. Equally, the law does not prohibit an unclassified document from being made public. Therefore, government employees play an important role in identifying the amount of government data capable of being made open or public by avoiding overclassification. (2)


There is also an IRM (Information Reference Model) (3) which aims to provide reference patterns to discover and manage data, describe data and to share and reuse data in a manner that is consistent across the government. This framework seems to be in place since 2013 (4), but there is no proof that it's being used and lacks full force of law. 

According to country focal point "Information and Statistics Centre is working on developing a National Data Strategy" (5). 

## References

1- https://qanoon.om/p/2007/l2007060/ 
2- https://opendata.om/2021/records-and-classification/

4- https://atollgroup.eu/wp-content/uploads/2015/05/casestudy_ita_2013_v07.pdf

Company register in Oman provide an integration layer to other platforms, however this integration is limited to Government entities only (1). The reason why the research did not find any product or service available in Oman using company data.

indicators.justification:
Land data is not publicly available as Open Data, and the research found no evidence of data is being used to influence policy in the interests of equitable and inclusive land tenure and use. Recently there have been lots of discussions around the new land grant law in Oman, but after the law released (1).
